problem.markdown:
>>According to the 1st Law of Thermodynamics:<< () some matter contains energy (x) energy can neither be created nor destroyed () energy can be created but never destroyed () energy may change form but some energy is always destroyed in transformation () we should aim to conserve energy whenever possible
[explanation] The 1st Law of Thermodynamics states that energy is neither created nor destroyed. The 2nd Law of Thermodynamics states that when energy changes form, or when it is used to produce work, some energy is always lost as heat. [explanation]
